channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reversing peanut advice prevented tens of thousands of allergy cases, researchers say

item.title: Books about race and gender to be returned to school libraries on some military bases

item.title: How the Democratic Brand Turned Radioactive in Rural America
item.description: The political scientist Suzanne Mettler examines the roots of America’s urban-rural divide and how Democrats can win back rural voters.

item.title: 5 things to know about Sanae Takaichi, Japan's first female prime minister

item.title: Stolen Louvre Jewelry Worth Over $100 Million, Paris Prosecutor Says

item.title: A 200-Year-Old Precedent Holds the Key to Trump’s Troop Deployment
item.description: The administration says the ruling, stemming from the seizure of an old mare, forbids judges from second-guessing his use of the National Guard.

item.title: Pardoned Capitol rioter arrested for allegedly threatening to kill Hakeem Jeffries
item.description: New York State Police say the man was arrested after they received word from the FBI that that he made "threats to kill a member of Congress."

item.title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Vice President JD Vance appeared undeterred by recent flare-ups of violence in Gaza, and he declined to set a deadline for when Hamas must disarm.

item.title: Portraits of China’s Changing Work force
item.description: In a nation grappling with economic uncertainty and sweeping demographic change, Chinese workers are reinventing themselves in unexpected ways.
